The Johns Hopkins Playshop Tuesday night opens its second feature
play of the season, The Duchess of
Malfi, an Elizabethan horror-melodrama by John Webster. The title
role will be played by Phyllis Til-

ley, with D Morris Stadd and Ernest
Cohn as her scheming brother and
her husband. The play is to be presented in period style as planned

lighting effects by Sam Chadcrw.

duchess whose fortune will fall to
her two brothers. Although she is
secretly married meanwhile, her villainous brother Ferdinand plots to
keep her from marrying. When he
finds out about her marriage, he
plans the murder of her, her husband,
and her children.

sympathy with Antonio, the duchess'
husband. John Lawton plays the part
of the Cardinal, the duchess' other
brother, and Alice Sterling is Cartels, her doomed maid.
